[ User Option ]



 This function has 5 sub-functionalities

 1.Horn Answer Back (+RK)

 2.Arm/Disarm By Key (+RK)

 3.Auto Door Lock (+RK)

 4.Seat Linkage Options

 5.Streeing Column Options

 If you are ready, select options from the left menu.

[OBD-II MONITORING TEST] 

 THE PURPOSE OF THIS SERVICE IS TO ALLOW TO ACCESS
 TO RESULTS FOR ON-BOARD DIAGNOSTIC MONITORING TESTS
 OF SPECIFIC COMPONENTS OR SYSTEM
 THAT ARE NOT CONTINUOUSLY MONITORED.
 1.CATALYST MONITORING(BANK1)
 2.CATALYST MONITORING(BANK2)
 3.EVAP.LEAK MONITORING(1mm)
 4.EVAP.LARGE LEAK
 5.EVAP.LEAK MONITORING(0.5mm)
 6.EVAP.CANISTER PURGE V/V OPEN
 7.EVAP.CANISTER CLOSING VALVE
 8.THERMOSTAT MONITORING

 SOME OF THE MONITORING RESULTS MAY BE INACCURATE.

 PRESS THE LEFT MENU OF RESULT, 
 IF YOU WANT TO CHECK THE RESULTS.

[ CPF Service Regeneration ]


 This test is used for removing the draft soot by diagnostic tool

 forcibly with no license.


 [ Fulfillment Condition ]


 1. Coolant Temperature : Above 70 'C

 2. Selector Lever : 'P(Park)' Position

 3. Engine at Idle

 4. Turn on the electrical system (A/C, Blower, Headlamp, Etc.)


 If you're ready, press [OK] button.

[ Injector Specific Data ]


 All injector data are erased and must be loaded into the ECM,

 again. Are you sure?

[ CPF Service Regeneration ]


 This test is used for removing the draft soot by diagnostic tool

 forcibly with no license.


 1. Coverage Driven Length : $$01 km


 2. Distance driven at last successful regeneration : $$02 km


 3. Distance driven at since successful regeneration : $$03 km


 4. Engine On Time : $$04 hr



 Press [OK] button to continue.

[ PODS Reset ]


 PODS comes from a passive occupancy detection system.

 PODS reset is consisted of 2 steps.


 The 1st Step : < Erase PODS ECU Fault >

 The DTCs of the PODS ECU are erased.

 The 2nd Step : < PODS Rezero >

 This step is an initialization of the PODS ECU.


 [[[ Erasing PODS... ]]]

#Test Conditions:#Please match the following test conditions and press OK button.

 - Engine RPM: over 0rpm 

 - A/C Compressor: OFF

 - Idle Switch: ON

 - Cooling Water Temperature: over 80 degrees Celsius.#

#Test Purpose#This test checks a mechanical error in the assembly of Timing Belt by comparing CKP and CMP signal using by serial communication.#Diagnostic Tips#Reference Value
CKP position when CMP is located falling edge : 38
CKP position when CMP is located rising edge : 98

 - It is OK if there can be deviations of 1~3 tooth according to the belt tension status.
- If miss the one sprocket tooth, there can be deviations of 5~6 tooth.(Timing adjustment and repair needed)#^629

[ Evap. Leakage Test ]


 Test failure due to mismatching from the one of the following
 condition.

 1) Engine operating status must be idle status.
 - Normal Closed Loop (Feedback) Status
 - ECT is higher than 80'C(176'Ｆ)
 2) No related DTC as belows
 - VSS/IAT Sensor, ISC/ECT Sensor
 - Related Evap./Fuel System
 - HO2S/TPS Sensor
 3) Fuel tank pressure has to be within a certain stable range.
 4) Time Limit
 - Wait 2 Minutes : After engine start
 - Wait 5 Minutes : Retry evap. air leakage mode
 (After activating evap. air leakage comletely)

 * If you want to retry evap. air leakage mode after testing this
 mode complete, please wait 5 minutes, and try again.

[ FL Solenoid Valve Test Mode ]


 [ Operator ]

 Brake pedal depressed and hold!


 [ Tester ]

 Is wheel blocked?

 If wheel is blocked, press [ START ] button.


 Press [ CANCEL ] button, if you want to exit.

[ Solenoid Valve Test Mode ]

 [ Function Description ]

 The solenoid valve test checks the electrical and hydraulic
 function of the ABS solenoid valves, fluid pressure line and
 installed brake fluid line as activating ABS fluid pressure
 controller manually.

 [ The Method Of Checking ]

 1. Move the vehicle to a lift.
 2. Locate shift gear at neutral.
 3. Release the park brake.
 4. Engine stop, ignition key on
 5. Co-worker gets ready to rotate the selected wheel.

 Don't press a brake pedal.

 Select the left menu, if you are ready.

[ FL Solenoid Valve Test Mode ]


 ABS valve pressure decreasing !

 1. Motor Pump Status : On

 2. Solenoid Valve Status : On


 [ Operator ]

 Brake pedal depressed and hold!


 [ Tester ]

 Wheel can be turned freely?

 If wheel is freely, solenoid valve test completed!

[ FL Solenoid Valve Test Mode ]


 Solenoid valve test is ended!


 If the wheel can not be turned, check the solenoid and HCU

 brake system. When you actuated the valves longer than 10 sec.,

 it is necessary to reduce the cycle of actuation and spend a

 wait time to prevent the valves from overheating.


 If you want to have a test of another valve, press [ OK ]

 button and select the test valves at the left menu.

[ RL Solenoid Valve Test Mode ]


 Solenoid valve test is ended!


 If the wheel can not be turned, check the solenoid and HCU

 brake system. When you actuated the valves longer than 10 sec.,

 it is necessary to reduce the cycle of actuation and spend a

 wait time to prevent the valves from overheating.


 If you want to have a test of another valve, press [ OK ]

 button and select the test valves at the left menu.

[ RR Solenoid Valve Test Mode ]


 [ Operator ]

 Brake pedal depressed and hold!


 [ Tester ]

 Is wheel blocked?

 If wheel is blocked, press [ START ] button.


 Press [ CANCEL ] button, if you want to exit.

[ RR Solenoid Valve Test Mode ]


 ABS valve pressure decreasing !

 1. Motor Pump Status : On

 2. Solenoid Valve Status : On


 [ Operator ]

 Brake pedal depressed and hold!


 [ Tester ]

 Wheel can be turned freely?

 If wheel is freely, solenoid valve test completed!

[ RR Solenoid Valve Test Mode ]


 Solenoid valve test is ended!


 If the wheel can not be turned, check the solenoid and HCU

 brake system. When you actuated the valves longer than 10 sec.,

 it is necessary to reduce the cycle of actuation and spend a

 wait time to prevent the valves from overheating.


 If you want to have a test of another valve, press [ OK ]

 button and select the test valves at the left menu.

#Test Condition# There should be no DTC Code.\n\nErase all DTC or fix the problem before the test.#

#Test Purpose#This test checks whether there is an error in the camshaft valve or in the CVVT oil control valve.#Test Conditions#- Engine RPM : between 600rpm and 5000rpm.\n- Engine oil temperature: between 20 'C (68'F) and 90 'C (194'F)#Diagnostic Tips#- Verify that there are DTC(s) for relating CVVT system or vehicle is in Limp home mode.#Test Description#The CVVT actuator is driven via diagnostic tool request to the ECU.\nIf the CAM CURRENT POSITION does not reach the CAM OBJECTIVE POSITION within the predetermined time frame, a CVVT system error is assumed.#

#Test Object#When Cylinder Power Balance Test Mode is activated, it automatically collects the speed of the crankshaft for 30 seconds and calculates each cylinder's average speed and displays it in a bar graph. A low reading can be caused by compression, fuel, or spark concerns.#Analysis Help#If certain cylinder rpm continues to show low.
- Not enough power on the cylinder.
- Check the fuel system of the cylinder.
- Check the ignition system of the cylinder.
- Check the compression pressure of the cylinder.#

#Test Condition#1. There should be no DTC Code.
Erase all DTC or fix the problem before the test.

2. Engine should be cranking or Idling.
Crank more than 5 seconds if there is a problem in ignition.#

 1. Check the DTC code of ABS system.
 2. Check contact state of HCU connector.
 3. Check selected wheel in accordance with HCU pressure fluid
 line.
 4. Check brake fluid leak and block.
 - Around wheel cylinder
 - Brake fluid pipe leak and block
 - Brake fluid pipe linkage leak
 5. Check again after air bleeding.
 6. Replace hydro unit.


 Press [OK] button after checking the items.

[ PODS Reset ]


 PODS comes from a passive occupancy detection system.

 PODS reset is consisted of 2 steps.


 The 1st Step : < Erase PODS ECU Fault >

 The DTCs of the PODS ECU are erased.

 The 2nd Step : < PODS Rezero >

 This step is an initialization of the PODS ECU.


 Press [OK] button, if you are ready.

 brake system. When you actuated the valves longer than 10 sec.,

 wait time to prevent the valves from overheating.

 button and select the test valves at the left menu.

[ Evap. Leakage Test ]

 This test is used for functional check of the evaporative system
 and leakage check.
 [ Caution ]
 If you want to retry evap. air leakage mode after test this mode
 successfully, please wait 5 minutes and try again.
 [ Condition ]
 1. Engine : Idle
 - Normal Closed Loop ( Feedback ) Status
 - ECT is higher than 80'C(176'Ｆ).
 2. No related DTC as below:
 - VSS/IAT Sensor, ISC/ECT Sensor
 - Related Evap./Fuel System
 - HO2S/TPS Sensor
 3. Fuel tank pressure has to be within a certain stable range
 (Test Fuel Level : 20 ~ 70%).
 4. Battery Voltage > 11V
 5. Time Limit
 - Wait 2 Minute : After engine start
 - Wait 5 minute : In case of retry evap. air leakage test after
 activating evap. leakage completely

 Press [OK] button to start.

[PCM Lock(MEC) Setting] 

 [Purpose]

 The PCM attached on vehicle is set 'Locked', before being
 delivered to customer, to protect the change of data or
 programs of PCM without any permission of manufacturer.
 After replacing the PCM in workshop, you should follow the
 'Security Check Procedure'.

 [When To Set 'MEC' To '00']

 Whenever replacing the PCM.

 [How To Confirm]

 Please check the data analysis item 'MEC(PCM Lock) Set'
 changed to 'ON'.


 If you are ready, press [OK] button.

[ CVT Learning Mode ]


 This function is used for learning CVT in case of CVT or TCU

 unit change.

 Follow the working procedure after entering learning mode.


 [ Condition ]

 1. CVT Oil Temperature : 30 ~ 70 'C

 2. Brake : On

 3. A/C : Off

 4. Engine : Idle

[ CVT Learning Mode ]

 [ Method ]

 1. D Range Learning (Repeat 10 times) : Stay N range for 7 sec.

 -> Move to D range (Stay for 3 sec) -> Move to N range

 2. R Range Learning (Repeat 10 times) : Stay N range for 7 sec.

 -> Move to R range (Stay for 3 sec.) -> Move to N range

 3. Stop this procedure when appear the completion message.

 4. Depress the brake pedal and move to P range, if you want to

 exit while performing this precedure.

[ CVT Learning Mode ]

 [ Method ]

 -> Move to D range (Stay for 3 sec) -> Move to N range

#Test Purpose#This test is to check the performance of the ISA Actuator by monitoring engine RPM, ISA Duty, ISA adaptation value. ISA will be initialized when ignition switch is turned off for more than 7 seconds.#Test Condition#- Idle after warm up the engine (above 80 'C (176('F))#Diagnostic Tips#If measured ISA duty different from the calculated ISA duty value either the engine RPM, consider checking parts related to air intake.#

#Test Purpose#This test is to check the performance of the MAF sensor by monitoring MAF value when RPM is deliberately decreased or increased.#Test Condition#- Idle after warm up the engine (above 80 'C (176'F))#Diagnostic Tips#If measured MAF value different from the calculated ISA duty value, check the part relating intake air system.#

#Test Purpose#This test is to check the performance of the HO2S as the fuel mixture is changed from lean to rich.#Test Description#When “Short trip fuel trim test” is activates it shows current data of the HO2S for 3seconds then it will show a round-trip from rich to lean for 2 cycles in every 3 seconds. Then It will show the current data again.#Test Condition#- Idle after warm up the engine (above 80 'C (176('F))#Diagnostic Tips#- If there is no response in HO2S, check the HO2S circuit, and verify correct operation of the air intake, ignition, and fuel delivery systems.#

[ Idle CO Adjustment ]


 1. Warm up the engine to normal operating temperature.

 2. Install CO tester to measure the CO gas at idle status.

 3. Change the value using [UP]/[DOWN] button.

 4. Press [SET] button to complete the adjusting value.

This function can register the sensor IDs to TPMS control module(TPMS ECU) after reading the sensor IDs of each tires.

3. press the Write button after reading all of the sensor IDs

#CKP TOOTH#CKP LONG TOOTH#CKP NOISE#CKP TOOTH ABNORMAL#CMP INVERT#CMP NOISE#CMP NOISE-TEMP#

테스트 목적
CKP/CMP 센서 신호 상태 및 노이즈 유입, TOOTH 상태 등을 검사한다. 

테스트 조건
- CKP/CMP 신호 정상 상태(CKP/CMP관련 고장코드가 없는 상태)
- 크랭킹 또는 공회전 상태

분석도움
- 시동불량 차량은 크랭킹 중에 표출되는 데이터 값을 판독하시오

#Test Purpose#The purpose of this test is checking the purge control solenoid valve’s status by monitoring A/F compensation ratio when the PCSV is activating.#Test Description#The ECM monitors air fuel ratio by activating the purge control solenoid valve operation duty 35% for 5 seconds.#The short-term fuel trim should respond PCSV actuation by increasing the amount of fuel delivered to the engine.#Diagnostic Tips#Check the purge control solenoid valve malfunction, if there is no response of correction value of air fuel ratio.#Notes#This test is not working during the fuel adaptation mode for 1 minute.#

#Test purpose#Checks noise interference and tooth status in CKP/CMP.#Test condition#- No DTC related to CKP/CMP (CKP/CMP no fault code should be found)\n- Cranking or idling#Diagnostic Tips#If DTC is found related to CKP/CMP erase the DTC code, then using signal test to test the cause or wrong signals triggered in CKP/CMP.#

#Test Condition#Match the following conditions

 - No DTC related to CKP/CMP (CKP/CMP no fault code should be found)

 - Cranking or idling#
#Test Purpose#This test is to whether evaporated gas is leaking or not by using actuator driving test mode.#Diagnostic Tips#Check whether any DTC codes are founded relating EVAP system.#^857

#Test Condition#Match the following conditions

- Vehicle Speed < 10km/h(6mph)
- Idle
- After Engine Start > 100 Seconds
- Ratio of evaporated gas < 38%
- Evaporated gas amount <0.022
- 11hpa < Fuel tank pressure < 4hpa
- 30% < Feedback control ratio < 20%
- 10V < Battery Voltage < 16V
- No DTC for HO2S, FTPS, Canister purge valve or Canister close valve
- Fuel level between 1/4 and 3/4 tank#

#Diagnostic Tips#This function will display up to the last 10 DTCs that were cleared from the memory of the Engine ECU.

DTCs will be displayed in the "Erased DTC" area in the order that the DTCs were cleared from the engine ECU.

Note:
After erasing confirmed DTCs, the engine must be turned off for 10 seconds before erased DTCs are written to the "Erased DTC" area.#

#검사 목적:

 - PCSV작동상태 확인.
 - CPPWM 값을 증감하여 (80h ~ 7Fh) 

즉 -50%에서 +50%까지 단계적으로 증가 시킨후 감소시킨다.

이 때 공연비 보정값과 ISC밸브.MAF값의 변화를 관찰하여 PCSV 밸브 작동유무를 검사 

검사 조건:

 - 엔진 회전수: 0rpm 초과 

 - 엔진 오일 온도: 80'C 이상 

 - NO DTC 

#

[ 검 사 결 과 ]


 테스트 모드를 수행할 수 없는 상태입니다.
 LPI 인젝터 리크(Leak) 테스트용 데이터로
 ECU를 업그레이드 후 테스트를 진행하시오.

[ 검 사 결 과 ]


 검사 조건이 맞지 않습니다.
 시동키 ON, 엔진 ON 하십시요.

[ LPI 인젝터 리크(Leak) 테스트 ]


 1. 현상

 - 엔진 공회전 부조(아이들시 인젝터 리크 증상)

 - 시동지연(엔진정지 후 인텍터 리크 증상)


 2. 테스트 조건

 - 차량 정지

 - 엔진 공회전 상태(워밍업 후)

 - 산소센서 정상

[ 검 사 결 과 ]


 공연비 제어 시스템이 정상적으로 작동하고
 있어 리크 인젝터를 판별하기 어려운 상태
 입니다.(리크량이 적은 경우)
 * 필요시 인젝터 탈거후 육안 점검 바랍니다.
 (0.3cc/분 이하 LEAK 는 정상이므로
 비눗물을 활용한 검사로 인젝터 교환 금지)

[ 검 사 결 과 ]


 인젝터 리크 증상이 예상됩니다.
 인젝터를 검사하시오.

[ 검 사 결 과 ]


 과다한 인젝터 리크 증상이 감지되었습니다.
 도움2를 참조하여 리크 인젝터를 판별 하시오.

[ 검 사 결 과 ]


 인젝터 1

 엔진 회전수 : RPM
 공연비 순시 보정값 : % 공회전 연료량 학습값 : mg/stk
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL1 : ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL2 : ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL3 : ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL4 : ms
 인젝터 연료량 조정값 : %

[ 검 사 결 과 ]


 인젝터 1

 엔진 회전수 : RPM
 공연비 순시 보정값 : %%01 %
 공회전 연료량 학습값 : %%02 mg/stk

 연료 분사 시간 - CYL1 : %%03 ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL2 : %%04 ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL3 : %%05 ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL4 : %%06 ms

 인젝터 연료량 조정값 : %%07 %

[ LPI 인젝터 리크(Leak) 테스트 ]
 도움 1
 1. 테스트 방법
 연료량 감걍 버큰을 조얼하여 해당 인젝터의 연료량을 감량한다.


 2. 분석방법1(약 18cc/min 이상 리크 증상시)

 - 정상 인젝터 : 각 인젝터별 연료량 감량시 연료량 부족 현상으로
 공회전 부조가 더 심하게 변함.(해당 인젝터 정상)

 - 리크 인젝터 : 각 인젝터별 연료량 감량시 리크 연료량 만큼
 감소되는 효과로 공회전 부조 현상이 없어짐.(해당 인젝터 리크)

[ LPI 인젝터 리크(Leak) 테스트 ]

 도움 2

 분석방법2(약 70cc/min 이상 과다 리크 증상시)

 과다한 인젝터 리크인 경우 해당 인젝터를 완전히 닫아도(완전감량)
 공회전시 부조 현상에 아무런 변화가 없는 경우가 있습니다.

 이때는 엔진룸에 있는 인젝터 커넥터를 차례대로 하니씩 탈거하여
 부조 현상에 아무런 변화가 없는 인젝터가 리크 인젝터 입니다.

 정상 인젝터를 탈거하면 부조현상이 더 심해집니다.
 상기 방법으로 판별이 불가능하면 테스트 모드를 사용.

[ 검 사 결 과 ]




 리크(Leak) 테스트를 할려는 인젝터를 왼쪽 메뉴에서 선택 하거나
도움 1,2를 참조 하시오.

 종료 : [CANCEL]

[ LPI 인젝터 리크(Leak) 테스트 ]

 도움 1

 1. 테스트 방법
 연료량 감걍 버큰을 조얼하여 해당 인젝터의 연료량을 감량한다.


 2. 분석방법1(약 18cc/min 이상 리크 증상시)

 - 정상 인젝터 : 각 인젝터별 연료량 감량시 연료량 부족 현상으로
 공회전 부조가 더 심하게 변함.(해당 인젝터 정상)

 - 리크 인젝터 : 각 인젝터별 연료량 감량시 리크 연료량 만큼
 감소되는 효과로 공회전 부조 현상이 없어짐.(해당 인젝터 리크)

[ LPI 인젝터 리크(Leak) 테스트 ]

 도움 2

 분석방법2(약 70cc/min 이상 과다 리크 증상시)

 과다한 인젝터 리크인 경우 해당 인젝터를 완전히 닫아도(완전감량)
 공회전시 부조 현상에 아무런 변화가 없는 경우가 있습니다.

 이때는 엔진룸에 있는 인젝터 커넥터를 차례대로 하니씩 탈거하여
 부조 현상에 아무런 변화가 없는 인젝터가 리크 인젝터 입니다.

 정상 인젝터를 탈거하면 부조현상이 더 심해집니다.
 상기 방법으로 판별이 불가능하면 테스트 모드를 사용.

[ LPI 인젝터 리크(Leak) 테스트 ]


 인젝터 2

 엔진 회전수 : RPM
 공연비 순시 보정값 : %
 공회전 연료량 학습값 : mg/stk

 연료 분사 시간 - CYL1 : ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL2 : ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL3 : ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL4 : ms

 인젝터 연료량 조정값 : %

[ LPI 인젝터 리크(Leak) 테스트 ]


 인젝터 2

 엔진 회전수 : $01 RPM
 공연비 순시 보정값 : $02 %
 공회전 연료량 학습값 : $03 mg/stk

 연료 분사 시간 - CYL1 : $04 ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL2 : $05 ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL3 : $06 ms
 연료 분사 시간 - CYL4 : $07 ms

 인젝터 연료량 조정값 : $08 %

[ Height Sensor Calibration ]


 This function is used for performing height sensor calibration,

 when the height sensor in ECS system or ECU is changed.


 [ Test Condition ]

 1. Ignition On, Engine Stop

 2. Vehicle must be positioned on "moving plates" to minimize
 lateral friction between wheels and ground.

 3. Height level : Normal Level State

 Warning !
 After beginning this function, you must complete it.
 If you can't complete this function, C1620 DTC is displayed
 and ECS warning lamp lights.

 [ Security Access Checking ...... ]

[ Height Sensor Calibration ]


 This function is used for performing height sensor calibration,

 when the hight sensor in ECS system or ECU is changed.


 [ Test Condition ]

 1. Ignition On, Engine Stop

 2. Vehicle must be positioned on "moving plates" to minimize
 lateral friction between wheels and ground.

 3. Height level : Normal Level State

 Warning !
 After begining this fuction, you must complete it.
 If you can't complete this function, C1620 DTC is displayed
 and ECS waring lamp lights.

 If you are ready, Press [OK]button.

[ Height Sensor Calibration ]

 <Data Read> : Stored values in the ECU module.
 <Data Write>: After measuring, Writing values in the ECU module.
 Do measure a height from wheel center to top edge of wheel
 housing, write the values according to priority.

 < Data Read >

 Front Left : mm
 Front Right : mm
 Rear Left : mm
 Rear Right : mm

 < Data Write >

 Front Left : mm
 Front Right : mm
 Rear Left : mm
 Rear Right : mm

 [ Now Testing ...... ]

[Caution]

1. When the D-Sub cable is removed, the wireless will take over the process reading the TPMS Sensor ID.
2. If the GDS TPMS is turned off during the process, the whole process should be started again after connecting the D-SUB cable.
3. Following the on screen instruction, remove the D-SUB cable to read the data from tires. After reading, connect the cable back on.

Disconnect the D-SUB cable.

Then, press the [OK] button.

[Caution]

1. When the D-Sub cable is removed, the wireless will take over the process reading the TPMS Sensor ID.
2. If the TPMS is turned off during the process, the whole process should be started again after connecting the D-SUB cable.
3. Following the on screen instruction, remove the D-SUB cable to read the data from all 4 tires. After reading, connect the cable back on.
(The process should be restarted if the D-SUB cable is in place before all the data is read.)

Disconnect the D-SUB cable.

Then, press the [OK] button.

[Wireless Mode]

1. This function is to check the status on each sensors.
2. Position the GDS TPMS as near as possible to the tire.
3. Data will be transmitted changing LF/RF LED to RED when [Enter] Key is pressed.
4. After the successful transmission of the data, the POWER LED will be turned on for ten seconds before it blinks for the next applicable tire.
5. If the data is not transmitted properly within the time, the LED will keep blink for the current tire.
6. When the all four tires' Sensor ID is transmitted successfully, the LED will remain turned on.
7. If D-SUB connector is connected without reading all 4 tires, only the data will be displayed up to the tire that was last read.

After reading all the TPMS data from 4 sensors, Connect the D-SUB connector then click [OK].
\nTPMS Module is connected.\nDisconnect the D-SUB connector, then press [Ok] button.
\nError has occurred, or the test is not complete.\nPlease re-run the test.
\nTPMS Module is not connected.\nConnect the D-SUB connector, then press [Ok] button.

[Wireless Mode]

1. The Sequence for reading the TPMS Sensor ID is as below.:
 (Front Left -> Front Right -> Rear Right -> Rear Left)
 GDS TPMS RED Power LED will blink depending on the position of the tires in the order. The number of time the LED blinks is as below:
 (Front Left: Once, Front Right: Twice, Rear Right: Three times, Rear Left: Four times)
2. Press the [ENTER] key after nearing the GDS TPMS to the each tires.
3. When Enter key is pressed, The LF/RF LED will turn ON as RED transmitting the data.
4. After the successful transmission of the data, the POWER LED will be turned on for ten seconds before it blinks for the next applicable tire.
5. If the data is not transmitted properly within the time, the LED will keep blink for the current tire.
6. When the all four tires’ Sensor ID is transmitted successfully, the LED will remain turned on.

After reading all the TPMS data from 4 sensors, Connect the D-SUB connector then click [OK].

*Function description * 

1. This function is to read sensor ID
 from TPMS Sensor in the Tire.
2. The data is composed of 8 alphanumeric characters.

 press the [OK] button.

*Function description * 

1. This function is to input sensor ID
 to TPMS control module(TPMS ECU),
 Which is used to operate the TPMS system properly.
2. The data is composed of 8 alphanumeric characters.
3. [Read ID] is current setting sensor ID,
 [Write ID] is new sensor ID.

 press the [OK] button.

[ Service Tips ]

 The way for the 'Compression & Injection Quantity comparison' test

 To determine the selection of abnormal Injectors try follow test.
 With the 'Injection Quantity comparison' mode of Scan tool, follow the below process.

 1. Symptoms : Engine hunting in 'Idle'
 2. Possible cause of problem :
 1) Injection quantity variation too high (low injection)
 2) Compression pressure too low or others
 3. Test Procedures
 1) Install the scan tool 'GDS or G-scan'
 2) Conduct the 'Injection Quantity Comparison' Test as below
 4. Basic Requirement before test
 1) Engine temperature : Over 70'C
 2) Gear position : N
 3) All electric power and A/C off

[ Service Tips ]

 Comparison of Test equipment

 This new Injector Tester CIT- 2000 is developed in addition to CRT-1000,
 in order to improve diagnostic efficiency and accuracy for vehicles equipped
 with Common Rail System.

 CIT-2000 makes it possible to perform Injection Quantity Comparison Test
 under the middle and high fuel pressure conditions,
 which it is not possible with GDS, G-SCAN or CIT-1000.
 Also Cylinder compression and Rail actuation test are additionally available.


 1. INJECTOR TEST
 Injection quantity Comparison Test

 2. COMPRESSION TEST
 Cylinder Compression comparison Test

 3. PRV ACTUATION TEST
 Pressure Control Valve Actuation test

[ Service Tips ]

 Injector return flow measuring

 1.Symptom
 1)Start delay, Acceleration slow, Engine stall, Start not possible

 2.Reason
 2) Fuel pressure build-up slow or not reached to target pressure by high return from Injector

 3. Procedure
 1) Check return flow with 'CRT-1000'
 1. Install test equipment
 1.1) Install measuring flask & pressure gage
 1.2) Disconnect IMV connector
 2. Measuring return flow
 2.1) Start measuring cycle (10 sec. X 3 times)
 2) Result Analysis
 1. Return OK & Fuel pressure OK
 - Required Low pressure Circuit test
 2. Return NG & Fuel pressure NG
 - Required #2 Injector Change
 3. Return OK & Fuel pressure NG
 - Required H/P Pump & Low pressure Circuit test
 4. More than 3 times the minimum return flow (Limit specification)
 - #2 Injector defect
 3) Action
 4) Monitoring

[ Service Tips ]

 High pressure test with CRT-1000

 BOSCH EURO- 3 SYSTEM (with PRV type)
 Purpose of this test is to reconfirm the High pressure pump performance test
 and identify where problems was Step 1-1(Back leak) test result are not in the value.
 (If high pressure value are lower than 700bar.)
 Avoid injector back leak completely by blocking the injector line on the rail.

 Test Procedure
 - Remove the Injector pipes from the rail
 - Install the dummy resistor to the connector of PCV control wire.
 - Block the rail using RAIL PLUG
 - Install the HP control wire and HP Gauge
 - Crank the engine to check the maximum High pressure
 SERVICE SPEC : Above 900 bar
 If measured pressure is above 1000bar,the high pressure is normal.

 DELPHI or EURO- 2 SYTEM (without PRV type)

 Test Procedure
 - Remove the Injector pipes from the rail
 - Removed the connector of Inlet Metering Valve (IMV)
 - Block the rail using RAIL PLUG
 - Install the HP Gauge
 - Selector mode switch of controller to Max High position
 - Crank the engine to check the maximum High pressure
 SERVICE SPEC : Above 1000 bar
 If measured pressure is above 1000bar,the high pressure is normal.

High pressure test wit CIT-2000

 BOSCH EURO- 3 SYTEM (with PRV type)
 Purpose of this test is to reconfirm the High pressure pump performance test
 and identify where problems was Step 1-1(Back leak) test result are not in the value.
 (If high pressure value are lower than 700bar.)
 Avoid injector back leak completely by blocking the injector line on the rail.

 Test Procedure
 - Remove the Injector pipes from the rail
 - Install the dummy resistor to the connector of PCV control wire.
 - Block the rail using RAIL PLUG
 - Install the HP controller and Gauge
 - Selector mode switch of controller to Max High position
 - Crank the engine to check the maximum High pressure
 SERVICE SPEC : Above 900 bar
 If measured pressure is above 1000bar,the high pressure is normal.

[ Functional Test (case4) ]


 Description :
 This chapter describes another hardware faulty besides fuel system.
 Please note that the symptom is similar to that of a fuel system faulty.

 Symptoms :
 Black smoke is emitted intermittently.
 Lack of power with smoke emitting when acceleration.
 DTC set in relation with swirl control system. (Go to 5. Swirl Control Valve System)

 Expected cause :
 1. EGR valve open stuck
 2. TURBO CHARGER SYSTEM damaged
 - VGT control valve stuck
 - TURBO CHARGER control valve leaked or damaged
 3. INTER COOLER or INTERCOOLER HOSE leaked
 4. THROTTLE FLAP VALVE stuck with closing position
 5. SWIRL CONTROL VALVE stuck


 Select Tree Menu, if you are ready.

[ Service Tips ]

 EGR System

 Symptoms :
 Black smoke is emitted intermittently.
 Lack of power with smoke emitting when acceleration.

 How to test :
 Remove the EGR connector and compare whether the smoke was reduced or not.

 If smoke was reduced = EGR valve open stuck.

 Field Fix :
 Using pliers, pull the valve and release it, Check whether the valve is closed
 without disturbance when it was released.

 If not, Spray the valve area with cleaning liquid and activate the valve in force until
 it moves smoothly, then blow off carbon using air gun and reinstall it to the engine.

[ Service Tips ]

 Turbo Charger or VGT System

 Symptoms :
 Black smoke is emitted intermittently.
 Lack of power with smoke emitting when acceleration. 

 Expected cause :
 VGT control valve was stuck due to carbon deposit on the valve stem area.
 Turbo charger Impeller blade was damaged. 
 Malfunction of torque converter control solenoid valve due to water contamination.

 How to test : 
 -Accelerate up to 3000rpm and release accel. pedal, watch actuator rod of VGT while acceleration.
 The rod should be pulled at idle and released gently when accelerated.
 Conduct this test several times and check if the rod is not working intermittently.
 -Check solenoid valve’s operation using vacuum gauge.

[ Service Tips ]

 INTERCOOLER system

 Symptoms :
 Black smoke is emitted intermittently.
 Lack of power with smoke emitting when acceleration.

 Expected cause :
 Air leaking from intake system

 How to test :
 Increase engine rpm and check whether whistle sound can be heard from intake system.
 (Intercooler and Hose connection area)

[ Service Tips ]

 Throttle Flap

 Symptoms :
 Heavy black smoke is emitted intermittently.
 Lack of power with smoke emitting when acceleration.

 Expected cause :
 THROTTLE FLAP stuck.

 How to test :
 Close the flap by hand gently and release it. Check whether the flap opens completely and smoothly.

 Field Fix :

 Remove hose and spray the flap area with cleaning liquid and wait for a while,
 Then move the flap open and close by hand until it moves smoothly.

 Remove foreign materials by air gun and rags, then spray the flap area with lubricant (WD40,etc) 
 and reinstall the hose.

 (Delphi system) or old Bosch models (before 04 MY), conduct the CASE 2 instead.

[ 모터 레졸버 보정 ]


 MCU는 모터(리어 플레이트)에 장착되어 있는 레졸버로부터

 정확한 위치정보를 센싱하여 야만 모터를 정확하게 제어하여

 출력및 제어정도를 확보할수 있습니다. MCU 교체, MCU 모터

 및 리어플레이트가 파워트레인에서 분해/장착 되는 경우엔

 반드시 다시 모터 레졸버 보정을 수행 하여야 합니다.


 [ 실행 조건 ]

 1. GEAR : P단 또는N단
 2. ENGINE RUN
 3. NO DTC


 진행하시려면, [OK] 버튼을 눌러주십시오

KEY ON AFTER KEY OFF
Press [OK] button.

-Check intake manifold boosting pressure using service date from GDS.
 It is normal if the pressure is more than 1.5 bar at full acceleration.
 In some vehicles, you may possible to measure intake boosting pressure using pressure gauge directly.
 When you use a pressure gauge refer that the pressure displayed from GDS is absolute pressure
 while pressure gauge displays gauge pressure.
 (1.5bar with absolute pressure equals 0.5 bar with gauge pressure.)

 Field Fix :
 In case of valve stuck, spray the valve area with cleaning liquid and activate the valve in force until
 it moves smoothly, then blow off carbon using air gun and reinstall it to the engine .

[ Service Tips ]

 Swirl Control Valve

 Symptoms :
 ECU sets DTC with SWIRL CONTROL SYSTEM.
 Slight smoke is occurred when acceleration.

 Expected cause :
 SWIRL CONTROL VALVE’S motor malfunction. (Carbon accumulated at brush area) $$ How to test :
 Warm up the engine more than approx. 80'C.
 Turn the ignition key off and check swirl control valve.
 The swirl control valve should be operated 3 times (open and close=1time) in condition with mentioned above.

 Swirl control valve should be closed at idle and opened when acceleration.

[ Parameter Download ]

 [ Condition ]

 1) Parking on the flat, Not Move.
 2) Vehicle Speed ( speed signal < 5 km/h).
 3) No effect in Gear Position 
 4) Engine Start Status - Engine RPM signal > 500 RPM
 5) Diagnosis Tester Connected.
 6) Vehicle - Normal CAN Signal Connected.
 7) Battery Voltage > 10.5 V.
 8) Light On (Low Beam).
 9) AFLS ON (AFLS OFF switch can't Press.)

 * Change For ECU

 Need to download specific parameters

 Error
 1) In Case of Download Air-Suspension Parameter
 in Steel Vehicle
 Show B1638 DTC Code 

 2) In Case of Download Steel Parameter
 in Air-Suspension Vehicle
 Show B1907,B1909 DTC Code 

 [ Solution ] 

 1 Download Delivery Parameter
 2 Check B1661(Parameter missing)
 3 Vehicle Engine Starting OFF
 4 Vehicle Engine Starting ON
 5 download all vehicle specific parameters 
 (Steel vehicle practice Calibration)

[Parking Mode]

 The purpose of function is to align sensors if 
 sensors are replaced or the vehicle has an accident 
 with structural damage that required wheel alignment

 * Alignment Condition

 1. No DTC.
 2. IG ON.
 3. Wheel Alignment by Chassis-Dynamo.
 4. Metal Plate has to be adjusted perpendicular to Chassis-Dynamo


 * Caution

 1. Neither people nor any material except the metal plate has to be in the specified space around the metal plate.
 1) Distance between sensor and plate.
 2) Within 1m of the rear side of metal plate.
 3) Within 0.5m of the right and left side of metal plate.
 4) Within 1m of the upper side of metal plate.

 2. After being failure of alignment, DTC(C1620) will be saved.
 Retry to align after erasing DTC.

[ HAC Enable/Disable ]


 This function is to enable or disable HAC function.

 HAC(Hill-start Assistant Control) is a function which keeps

 back from vehicle sliding down by holding brake pressure

 when vehicle starts on the hill after standstill


 [ Condition ]

 1. IG On

 2. ENG Stop


 Press [OK], If you are ready !

 C1:Enable

 C2:Disable

[ Longitudinal Sensor Calibration ]

 This function is to initialize longitudinal sensor offset value. 

 It should be performed after replacing sensor or ECU.

 [ Condition ]

 1. HAC Status: Enabled 

 2. IG On, ENG Off 

 3. Vehicle standstill state on a flat ground without any inclination

 4. Arrange the steering wheel at the center position

 5. Normal tire pressure condition

 6. Normal loading condition [no excessive loading allowed]


 Press [OK], if you are ready !

 in engine room. It may harm the engine parts.
 Please open vehicle hood
 and take off the engine cover to protect engine part

[Longitudinal G Sensor Calibration]

 Reset the studied values of ECU and
 Calibrate offset of the AX sensor to zero again.

 Must be fulfilled when the YAW sensor or ESC H/UNIT is replaced.


 Confirming Method : Check DTC after the process

 Warning :
 C1285, illuminating ECS warning lamp, insensitive/sensitive

 working cause to misjudge of the gradient might occur

 if the process is not fulfilled.

[Longitudinal G Sensor Calibration]

 1)No DTC related to Longitudinal G Sensor.

 2)Car must be stopped longer than 1 sec.

 3)On the flat ground.

 4)Maximum range of the slope must be within ± 1% (0.57˚)

 5)Straighten up the steering wheel.

 6)Tire pressure must be under the regulation.

 7)IG. ON or Engine Idle.

 경사각 보정 값 : $$02' 



 보정 결과가 적용되기 위해서는 KEY OFF상태 5초간 유지가

[ 경사각 센서 위치학습 ]


 HCU는 경사각 센서를 이용하여 차량의 경사도를 측정합니다.

 이값을 이용하여 경사로 밀림방지기능 이나 Idle Stop 진입제한

 등의 기능을 구현합니다 HCU 교체 또는 경사각 센서의 탈장

 착시 보정을 수행 하여야 합니다


 [ 실행 조건 ]

 1. KEY ON

 2. ENGINE STOP

 3. GEAR : N

 4. A flat ground(평평한 곳)

 진행하려면, [OK] 버튼을 누르시오.

[ Driving Mode ]

 The purpose of function is to align sensors if sensors are replaced 
 or the vehicle has an accident with structural damage that required 
 wheel alignment

 * Alignment Condition

 1. No DTC
 2. Vehicle Speed : Above 50Kph.
 3. The vehicle needs to be driven behind the passenger car 
 (not behind SUV, bus or truck) at a distance of about 30 to 90 meters

 * Caution

 1. No strong steering wheel actions such as turn to right or left, 
 sudden lane change to complete the alignment in minimum time. 
 
 ( Alignment will be stopped if the items below):

 1) The vehicle encounter the curves radius smaller than 100 m
 2) The vehicle acceleration/deceleration more than 2 m/s² 
 3) Vehicle speed is lower than 10 kph
 4) Vehicle is in a tunnel or under pass

 2. After being failure of alignment, DTC(C1620) will be saved.
 Retry to align after erasing DTC.

[ HAC & BLA Enable/Disable ]


 This function is to enable or disable HAC function.

 HAC(Hill-start Assistant Control) is a function which keeps

 back from vehicle sliding down by holding brake pressure

 when vehicle starts on the hill after standstill.

 BLA(Brake Lamp Actuator) is a function which turn brake lamp on

 while HAC function is operating. 


 [ Condition ]

 1. IG On

 2. ENG Stop


 Press [OK], If you are ready !

 HAC(Hill-start Assistant Control) is a function which

 keeps back from vehicle sliding down by holding brake

 pressure when vehicle starts on the hill after standstill.

 In case of A/T vehicle this function should be

 performed for enabling HAC function because initial

 state of HAC is disable after ECU replacement.

 [ CONDITION ]

 1. NO DTC
 2. IG ON
 3. Vehicle with AT & ESP


 The present state : $$01

[ BLA Enable/Disable ]


 This function is to enable or disable BLA function.

 BLA(Brake Lamp Actuator) is a function which turn on the

 brake lamp automatically during HAC function working.

 In case of A/T vehicle this function should be

 performed for enabling HAC function because initial

 state of HAC is disable after ECU replacement.

 [ CONDITION ]

 1. NO DTC
 2. IG ON
 3. Vehicle with AT & ESP


 The present state : $$01

[ Longitudinal G sensor Calibration ]

 This function is to initialize offset value of the longitudinal

 G sensor. This function should be performed when the YAW

 sensor or ECU is replaced.


 [ CONDITION ]

 1. HAC state: Enabled 
 2. NO DTC 
 3. IG On, ENG Off
 4. Maximum range of the slope must be within ± 1% (0.57deg)
 5. Straighten up the steering wheel
 6. Tire pressure must be under the regulation
 7. No overload condition


 Press [OK] button, if you are ready.

$s$[Monitoring Oxygen Sensor Signal]$e$


 To perform Oxygen Sensor's efficiency test,
 GDS is monitoring all Oxygen Sensor signal status.


Please wait…

The battery is low voltage or hi voltage.
 Please check the charging system.
Excessive signal in Bank 1 Up-stream Oxygen Sensor (B1/S1) is retained. check areas where Air Fuel Ratio can be impacted. To continue without checking, press [OK] button.

State feedback control : OFF 
 Oxygen Sensor Related Connector, and check the wiring.

Abnormal signal from bank up-stream oxygen sensor (B1/S1) is detected. This usually indicates that a short circuit near oxygen sensor's signal circuit or a short circuited heater circuit. Check for any faulty connections and short circuits near affected areas. To ignore and continue, press [OK] button.

Active oxygen sensor : OFF 
 Oxygen Sensor Related Connector, and check the wiring.
Excessive signal in Bank 2 Up-stream Oxygen Sensor (B2/S1) is retained. Check areas where air fuel ratio can be impacted (Fuel line/Intake line). To continue without checking, press [OK] button.

Signal in Bank 2 Up-stream Oxygen Sensor (B2/S1) is weak. Check for short circuits where oxygen sensor is connected or Air Fuel Ratio is not being controlled properly. Check for a short circuit in oxygen sensor connector or fault in fuel/intake line. To continue without checking, press [OK] button.

Bank1 Up-stream oxygen sensor (B2/S1)signal is abnormal. There may be a short circuit present near oxygen sensor's signal circuit or a short circuited heater circuit. Check for any faulty connections and short circuits near affected areas. To ignore and continue, press [OK] button.

Front oxygen sensor : LEAN! 
 Test can not continue. 
 First, Please check the fuel and the Air system.

Down stream Oxygen sensor (B1/S1) signal output pattern matches the up stream Oxygen sensor signal output. This indicates that there may be faults in the exhaust system or faults due to Catalyst aging. Repair the affected areas first, then run the test again. press [OK] button.

Signal in down stream Oxygen sensor (B1/S2) is weak. This symptom can be found when there is a fault in fuel line or exhaust system. Repair the affected areas first, then run the test again. press [OK] button.

Down stream Oxygen sensor (B2/S2) signal output pattern matches the up stream Oxygen sensor signal output. This indicates that there may be faults in the exhaust system or faults due to Catalyst aging. Repair the affected areas first, then run the test again. To continue without repairing, press [OK] button.

Signal in down stream Oxygen sensor (B2/S2) is weak. This symptom can be found when there is a fault in fuel line or exhaust system. Repair the affected areas first, then run the test again. To continue without repairing, press [OK] button.

Bank1 down-stream oxygen sensor (B2/S2)signal is abnormal. There may be short circuits present near oxygen sensor's signal circuit or a short circuited heater circuit. Check for faulty connections and short circuits near areas affected. To ignore and continue, press [OK] button.
Oxygen Sensor Signal Test during idle has been completed. Perform Oxygen Sensor's efficiency test while accelerating.

[ Auto Detected Configuration Reset ]


 The automatically detected configuration into engine management

 system from assembly factory like Automatic transmission, TCS,

 Vehicle speed, Air conditioner, MAP sensor, Auto cruise and

 Battery management configuration may reset by this function.


 [Usage]

 If wrong configuration has recognized or if user want set up used

 engine management system from other vehicle,

 user must use this function.


 [Condition]

 1. Before reset the configuration, please check all the controller

 and sensor has set up properly or not.

 2. Ignition KEY ON & Engine stop state.


 * When the reset procedure finish, user need to turn ignition key off.

 And then when ignition key on, new auto detected configuration

 will be set up into engine management system.

[DCT Learning Function] 
DCT Learning function consists of 3 steps 
 1.Gear-Box Geometry learning
 2.Clutch Characteristic learning
 3.Shifting position learning 

[Step1] This step is for Gear-Box Geometry learning.
 Please press [OK] button after setting all condition.
 
<Test condition> 
 -Engine "OFF", Ignition key "ON" 
 -Brake/Parking brake "Engaged"
 -Shift lever "P"
 -No related DTC

* You can activate DCT learning function only one time after
 IG ON. If you want to retry this function again, 
 please re-start diagnostic tool again after IG OFF and ON.

[DCT Learning Function] 
DCT Learning function consists of 3 steps 
 1.Gear-Box Geometry learning
 2.Clutch Characteristic learning
 3.Shifting position learning 

[Step2] This step is for Clutch Characteristic learning.
 Please press [OK] button after setting all condition.
 
<Test condition> 
 -Brake/Parking brake "Engaged"
 -Vehicle stand still
 -Shift lever "P"
 -Engine "ON"
 -Engine RPM 6,000 until success message (apprx. 30 sec.)

[DCT Learning Function] 
DCT Learning function consists of 3 steps 
 1.Gear-Box Geometry learning
 2.Clutch Characteristic learning
 3.Shifting position learning 

[Step3] This step is for shifting position learning.
 Please keep idle status for 5minutes to stabilize the engine.
 Please press [OK] button after setting all condition.
 
<Test condition> 
 -Engine running in idle speed
 -stabilized engine condition
 -Brake/Parking brake "Engaged"
 -Vehicle stand still
 -Shift lever 'P'

Test Completed !!!

 Please wait for 20s after Ignition Off.
 Please press [OK]button after Ignition ON.
 (※Please erase DTC after checking it.)

Condition Insufficiency!!! or Test Failure!!! 

 Press [OK] Button.

 in case of replacing MCU, Motor or HSG

 to control Motor an HSG.

 in case of replacing MCU, Motor or HSG.

[ LPG 엔진 조정 모드 ]


 < 1단계 : 사전 준비 >

 1. 엔진을 정상온도 (냉각 수온 80'C 이상)까지 난기시킵니다.

 2. 무부하 아이들 상태를 유지합니다.

 - 모든 전기 부하 (에어컨 등) : OFF

 - 조향 핸들 정위치, 변속레버 : P/N

 3. 엔진 회전수가 700~850 rpm 인지 확인합니다.

< 2단계 : 차량 상태 점검 >

 1. 점화 시기를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 점화 시기 : BTDC 15 ± 1'

 * 테스트 단자 Q와 S를 점프합니다.

 # Test_Terminal_1.jpg #

 자기진단 커넥터(Q,S 단자)

 # Test_Terminal_2.jpg #

 커넥터 단자 위치


 2. 점화 시기가 사양을 벗어나면 배전기 하우징을 돌려

 조정합니다.

< 3단계 : 아이들 회전수 조정 >

 1. 아이들 회전수가 사양과 일치하도록 믹서의 공기량 조정

 스크류(AAS)로 조정합니다.

 - 규정 아이들 회전수 : 800 ± 50 rpm

 ** 참고 : AAS 회전 방향

 - 시계 방향 : 아이들 회전수 낮아짐

 - 반시계 방향 : 아이들 회전수 높아짐

< 4단계 : 아이들 업 회전수 점검 >

 1. 규정 아이들 회전수를 확인합니다. (800 ± 50 rpm)

 2. 에어컨 ON 시 엔진 회전수를 확인합니다.

 - 아이들 업 회전수 : MT - 900 ± 50 rpm

 AT - 850 ± 50 rpm

< 5단계 : 아이들 업 회전수 점검 >

 1. 규정 아이들 회전수를 확인합니다. (800 ± 50 rpm)

 2. 에어컨 ON 시 엔진 회전수를 확인합니다.

 - 아이들 업 회전수 : MT - 900 ± 50 rpm

 AT - 850 ± 50 rpm

 ** 엔진 회전수가 맞지 않으면 하기 절차를 참조하여

 아이들 업 회전수를 조정하십시오.

 1) 에어컨 아이들 업 솔레노이드 커넥터를 접지시킵니다.

 2) 에어컨 아이들 업 조정나사를 조정하여 엔진 회전수를

 1400 ± 20 rpm 으로 맞춥니다.

 3) 테스트 단자를 분리합니다.

 4) 아이들 회전수를 확인합니다. (800 ± 50 rpm)

< 6단계 : 타르 제거 >

 타르 제거 후 주행거리가 5000 km 이상 경과된 차량에

 대해서는 베이퍼라이저 하단부의 타르 레버를 사용하여

 타르를 제거합니다.

 참고) 타르 제거 수순

 1) 차량을 난기시킵니다.

 2) 시동을 끕니다.

 3) 타르레버를 수평으로 위치하여 타르를 제거합니다.

 (20초 정도)

 4) 타르 제거 레버를 잠급니다.

$S$ 메인 솔레노이드 듀티\c $$01\c %\c (0x00, 0x64)\r 슬로우 솔레노이드 듀티\c $$02\c %\c (0x00, 0x64)\r 냉각 수온 센서\c $$03\c 'C\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 엔진 회전수\c $$04\c rpm\c (0x00, 0x1F40)\r 점화 시기 (진각)\c $$05\c \c (0xCE, 0x32)\r 산소 센서\c $$06\c mV\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r ISC 솔레노이드 듀티 (3P)\c $$07\c %\c (0x00, 0x64)\r 에어컨 컷 릴레이\c $$08\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 인히비터 스위치 (A/T)\c $$09\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r $E$

Signal in Bank 1 Up-stream Oxygen Sensor (B1/S1) is weak. Check for short circuits where oxygen sensor is connected. Air Fuel Ratio is not being controlled properly. Check for a short circuit in oxygen sensor connector or fault in fuel/intake line. To continue without checking, press [OK] button.

Up-stream oxygen sensor (B1/S1) signal is abnormal. There may be short circuits present near oxygen sensor's signal circuit or a short circuited in the connector. Check for any faulty connections and short circuits near areas affected. To ignore and continue, press [OK] button.

Signal in Bank 1 down-stream Oxygen sensor (B1/S2) is weak. There may be a short circuit present where oxygen sensor is connected or Air Fuel Ratio is rarely being controlled. Check for a short circuit in oxygen sensor connector or fault in fuel/intake/exhaust line. To continue without checking, press [OK] button.

Down-stream oxygen sensor (B1/S2)signal is abnormal. There may be short circuits present near oxygen sensor's power circuit or a short circuited in the connector. Check for any faulty connections and short circuits near affected areas. To ignore and continue, press [OK] button.

[ Longitudinal G sensor Calibration ]

 This function is to initialize offset value of the longitudinal

 G sensor. This function should be performed when the YAW

 sensor or ECU is replaced.


 [ CONDITION ]

 1. HAC state: Enabled 
 2. NO DTC 
 3. IG On, ENG Off
 4. Maximum range of the slope must be within ± 1% (1 deg)
 5. Straighten up the steering wheel
 6. Tire pressure must be under the regulation
 7. No overload condition


 Press [OK] button, if you are ready.

Bank1 down-stream oxygen sensor (B1/S2)signal is abnormal. There may be short circuits present near oxygen sensor's signal circuit or a short circuited heater circuit. Check for any faulty connections and short circuits near areas affected. To ignore and continue, press [OK] button.
Collection of oxygen sensor data has been completed. Take foot off the accelerator and maintain idle status.

[ PSB Variant Coding ]

 When replacing the ECU, this function sets the ECU
 settings to the vehicle's specification.

 [ CONDITION ]

 1. IG ON

 * Warning

 Please take extra care when saving the value.

Signal in Bank 2 Up-stream Oxygen sensor (B2/S1) is weak. There may be a short circuit present where oxygen sensor is connected or Air Fuel Ratio is not being controlled properly. Check for a short circuit in oxygen sensor connector or fault in fuel/intake/exhaust line. To continue without checking, press [OK] button.

Up-stream oxygen sensor (B2/S1) signal is abnormal. There may be short circuits present near oxygen sensor's signal circuit or a short circuited in the connector. Check for any faulty connections and short circuits near affected areas. To ignore and continue, press [OK] button.

Signal in Bank 2 down-stream Oxygen sensor (B2/S2) is weak. There may be a short circuit present where oxygen sensor is connected or Air Fuel Ratio is rarely being controlled. Check for a short circuit in oxygen sensor connector or fault in fuel/intake/exhaust line. To continue without checking, press [OK] button.

[ LPG 엔진 조정 모드 ]


 < 1단계 : 사전 준비 >

 1. 엔진을 정상온도까지 난기시킵니다.

 2. 무부하 아이들 상태를 유지합니다.

 - 모든 전기 부하 (에어컨 등) : OFF

 - 조향 핸들 정위치, 변속레버 : P/N

< 2단계 : 점화시기 및 아이들 회전수 점검 >

 1. 점화 시기를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 점화 시기 : BTDC 5 ± 1'

 참고) 점화시기 조정 단자를 접지합니다.

 2. 아이들 회전수를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 아이들 회전수 : 750 ± 50 rpm

 참고) 필요하면 공기조정 스크류(AAS)로 엔진 속도를

 조정합니다.

< 3단계 : 아이들 공연비 조정 및 CO 조정 >

 1. 피드백 솔레노이드 밸브값이 규정을 벗어나면 베이퍼

 라이저의 공연비 조정 나사 (IAS)를 돌려 메인 듀티를 조정

 합니다.

 - 규정 메인 듀티 솔레노이드 값 : 50 ± 10 % (40 ~ 60 %)

 - 규정 아이들 CO값 : 0.1 % 이하 (규정치 : 1.2 % 이하)

 2. 엔진을 2000 ~ 3000 rpm으로 가/감속한 후 재확인합니다.

 * 아이들 공연비 조정전 베이퍼라이저의 1차 압력 및 기본

 점검을 완료한 후 진행합니다.

< 4단계 : 아이들 업 회전수 점검/조정 >

 1. 헤드램프 (에어컨, 자동변속기)를 켜서 아이들 업

 솔레노이드를 작동시킵니다.

 2. 아이들 업 회전수를 확인한 후 규정치를 벗어나면 스크류

 를 돌려 조정합니다.

 - 규정 아이들 업 속도 : 850 ± 50 rpm

< 5단계 : 타르 제거 >

 1. 주행거리가 5,000 km 이상 경과된 차량에 대해서는 베이퍼

 라이저 하단부의 타르 레버를 사용하여 타르를 제거합니다.

 1) 차량을 난기시킵니다.

 2) 시동을 OFF합니다.

 3) 타르 배출 레버를 수평으로 위치하여 타르를 제거

 합니다.


 * 타르 배출 레버의 열림 또는 닫힘을 확인합니다.

$S$ 피드백 솔레노이드\c $$01\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 냉각 수온 센서\c $$02\c 'C\c (0x00, 0xAA)\r 흡기온 센서\c $$03\c 'C\c (0x14, 0x8C)\r 엔진 회전수\c $$04\c rpm\c (0x00, 0x7D00)\r 점화 시기\c $$05\c \c (0x1C, 0xE4)\r 산소센서(B1/S1)\c $$06\c mV\c (0x00, 0xDC)\r 공회전속도조절밸브\c $$07\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 에어컨 릴레이\c $$08\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r $E$

< 2단계 : 점화시기 및 아이들 회전수 점검 >

 1. 점화 시기를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 점화 시기 : BTDC 5 ± 2'

 참고) 점화시기 조정 단자를 접지합니다. (RCT 단자)

 2. 아이들 회전수를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 아이들 회전수 : 800 ± 100 rpm

 * ISCA 장착 차량은 아이들 회전수 조정이 불필요합니다.

< 3단계 : 아이들 공연비 조정 >

 1. 메인듀티솔레노이드 값이 규정을 벗어나면 베이퍼

 라이저의 공연비 조정 나사 (IAS)를 돌려 메인 듀티를

 조정합니다.


 - 규정 메인듀티솔레노이드 값 : 50 ± 10 % (40 ~ 60 %)

 확인 : 증발 가스 누설 시험 종료
 취소 : 이전 화면

< 4단계 : 아이들 공연비 확인 >

 1. 차량 정지 상태에서 엔진 회전수를 2000 ~ 3000 rpm으로

 가/감속을 실시한 후, 메인듀티솔레노이드값을 확인하여

 규정치를 벗어날 경우 재조정합니다.


 - 규정 메인듀티솔레노이드 값 : 50 ± 10 % (40 ~ 60 %)

< 5단계 : 아이들 공연비 확인 >

 1. 차량 정지 상태에서 엔진 회전수를 2000~3000 rpm 으로

 10초간 가속을 3회 실시한 후, 메인 듀티값을 확인하여

 규정치를 벗어날 경우 재조정합니다.


 - 규정 메인 듀티 솔레노이드 값 : 50 ± 10 %

< 6단계 : 타르 제거 >

 1. 주행거리가 5000 km 이상 경과된 차량에 대해서는 베이퍼

 라이저 하단부의 타르 레버를 사용하여 타르를 제거합니다.

 참고) 타르 제거 수순

 1) 차량을 난기시킵니다.

 2) 시동을 끕니다.

 3) 타르레버를 수평으로 위치하여 타르를 제거합니다.

 (20초 정도)

 4) 타르 레버를 돌려서 스토퍼와 닿도록하여 잠급니다.

$S$ 메인 듀티 솔레노이드\c $$01\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 슬로우 듀티 솔레노이드\c $$02\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 냉각 수온 센서\c $$03\c 'C\c (0x00, 0xAA)\r 흡기온 센서\c $$04\c 'C\c (0x14, 0x8C)\r 엔진 회전수\c $$05\c rpm\c (0x00, 0x7D00)\r 점화 시기\c $$06\c \c (0x1C, 0xE4)\r 산소 센서 (B1/S1)\c $$07\c mV\c (0x00, 0xDC)\r 공회전 속도조절 밸브\c $$08\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r $E$

 2. 아이들 회전수를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 아이들 회전수 : 730 ± 100 rpm

 2. 아이들 회전수를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 아이들 회전수 : 700 ± 100 rpm

< 2단계 : 점화시기 및 아이들 회전수 점검 >

 1. 점화 시기를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 점화 시기 : BTDC 5 ± 2'

 참고) 점화시기 조정 단자를 접지합니다.

 2. 아이들 회전수를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 아이들 회전수 : 800 ± 50 rpm

 참고) 필요하면 공기조정 스크류(AAS)로 엔진 속도를

[ LPG 엔진 조정 모드 ]


 < 1단계 : 사전 준비 >

 1. 엔진을 정상온도 (냉각 수온 80'C 이상)까지 난기시킵니다.

 2. 무부하 아이들 상태를 유지합니다.

 - 모든 전기 부하 (에어컨 등) : OFF

 - 조향 핸들 정위치, 변속레버 : P/N

 3. 규정 공회전수 확인 : 850 ± 100 rpm

< 2단계 : 점화 시기, 아이들 회전수 및 엔진 공연비 조정 >

 1. 점화 시기 및 아이들 회전수 점검

 - 규정 점화 시기 : BTDC 5 ± 2'

 - 규정 아이들 회전수 확인 : 850 ± 100 rpm

 참고) 점화 시기 조정 단자 접지합니다. (시리우스 엔진)

 2. 엔진 공연비 조정

 메인 듀티 솔레노이드값이 규정을 벗어나면 베이퍼

 라이저의 공연비 조정 나사 (IAS)를 돌려 메인 듀티를

 조정합니다.

 - 규정 메인 듀티 솔레노이드 값 : 50 ± 5 % (45 ~ 55 %)

흡기 온도 ('C) 메인 듀티 (%)


 30 이하 35 ± 5

 31 ~ 40 40 ± 5

 41 ~ 50 45 ± 5

 51 ~ 60 50 ± 5

 61 ~ 70 55 ± 5

 80 이상 조정 금지


 * 냉각팬 작동시 듀티 조정 금지

 * 엔진 회전수를 2000~3000 rpm 으로 가속 후 듀티값을

 재확인 합니다.

< 3단계 : 타르 제거 >

 1. 주행거리가 5,000 km 이상 경과된 차량에 대해서는 베이퍼

 라이저 하단부의 타르 레버를 사용하여 타르를 제거합니다.

 1) 차량을 난기시킵니다.

 2) 시동을 OFF합니다.

 3) 타르 배출 레버를 수평으로 위치하여 타르를 제거

 합니다.


 * 타르 배출 레버의 열림 또는 닫힘을 확인합니다.

$S$ 메인 듀티 솔레노이드\c $$01\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 슬로우 듀티 솔레노이드\c $$02\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 냉각 수온 센서\c $$03\c 'C\c (0x00, 0xA0)\r 흡기온 센서\c $$04\c 'C\c (0x00, 0x78)\r 엔진 회전수\c $$05\c rpm\c (0x00, 0x7D00)\r 점화 시기\c $$06\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 산소 센서 (B1/S1)\c $$07\c mV\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 공회전 속도조절 밸브\c $$08\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 에어컨 릴레이\c $$09\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r $E$

[ LPG 엔진 조정 모드 ]


 < 1단계 : 사전 준비 >

 1. 엔진을 정상온도 (냉각 수온 80'C 이상)까지 난기시킵니다.

 2. 무부하 아이들 상태를 유지합니다.

 - 모든 전기 부하 (에어컨 등) : OFF

 - 조향 핸들 정위치, 변속레버 : P/N

 3. 엔진 회전수가 750~850 rpm 인지 확인합니다.

< 2단계 : 점화 시기 및 아이들 회전수 점검 >

 1. 점화 시기 및 아이들 회전수를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 점화 시기 : BTDC 20 ± 1'

 - 규정 아이들 회전수 : 750 ~ 850 rpm

 2. 점화 시기가 사양을 벗어나면 배전기 하우징을 돌려 조정

 합니다.

< 3단계 : 아이들 업 회전수 점검 >

 1. 규정 아이들 회전수를 확인합니다.

 - 아이들 회전수 : 800 ± 50 rpm

 2. 조건에 맞는 부하 (해당 스위치 ON)를 준 후, 엔진 회전수

 를 확인합니다. 만약 사양을 벗어나면 조정 나사를 돌려

 조정합니다.

 - 에어컨 : 900 ~ 950 rpm

 - 전기 부하 (헤드램프, 파워스티어링) : 850 ~ 900 rpm

< 4단계 : 아이들 CO 조정 >

 1. 아이들 CO를 측정합니다.

 - 규정값 : 1.5 ~ 2.5

 2. 측정치가 규정값을 벗어나면 MAS-II를 돌려 조정합니다.

 1) 아이들 CO가 2% 이상 : MAS-II를 반시계 방향으로 회전

 2) 아이들 CO가 2% 이하 : MAS-II를 시계 방향으로 회전


 * 아이들이 어긋나면 다시 조정해야 합니다.

< 5단계 : 아이들 업 회전수 점검 >

 1. 규정 아이들 회전수를 확인합니다.

 - 아이들 회전수 : 800 ± 50 rpm

 2. 수동변속기 차량

 1) 에어컨 및 블로워 스위치 ON : 900 ~ 950 rpm (조정나사 : A)

 2) 헤드램프 ON : 850 ~ 900 rpm (조정나사 : B)

 3. 자동변속기 차량

 - 변속 레버 D 레인지 : 800 ~ 850 rpm

$S$ 피드백 솔레노이드 듀티\c $$01\c %\c (0x00, 0x64)\r 냉각 수온 센서\c $$02\c 'C\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 엔진 회전수\c $$03\c rpm\c (0x00, 0x1F40)\r 점화 시기 (진각)\c $$04\c \c (0xCE, 0x32)\r 산소 센서\c $$05\c mV\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 아이들업 솔레노이드1 (A/C)\c $$06\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 아이들업 솔레노이드2 (E/L)\c $$07\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 아이들업 솔레노이드3 (A/T)\c $$08\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 에어컨 컷 릴레이\c $$09\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r $E$

$S$ 피드백 솔레노이드 밸브\c $$01\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 슬로우 듀티 솔레노이드\c $$02\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 냉각 수온 전압\c $$03\c V\c (0x00, 0x400)\r 흡기 온도\c $$04\c 'C\c (0x00, 0x78)\r 엔진 회전수\c $$05\c rpm\c (0x00, 0x5DC0)\r 점화 시기\c $$06\c \c (0x1C, 0xE4)\r 산소 센서 전압\c $$07\c V\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r ISC 밸브 듀티\c $$08\c %\c (0x00, 0xFF)\r 에어컨 컷 릴레이\c $$09\c \c (0x00, 0xFF)\r $E$

[ LPG 엔진 조정 모드 ]


 < 1단계 : 사전 준비 >

 1. 엔진을 정상온도 (냉각 수온 80'C 이상)까지 난기시킵니다.

 2. 무부하 아이들 상태를 유지합니다.

 - 모든 전기 부하 (에어컨 등) : OFF

 - 조향 핸들 정위치, 변속레버 : P/N

 3. 규정 공회전수 확인 : 850 ± 50 rpm

< 2단계 : 점화 시기 점검 >

 1. 점화 시기를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 점화 시기 : BTDC 15 ± 1'

 * 테스트 단자 Q와 S를 점프합니다.

 # Test_Terminal_1.jpg #

 자기진단 커넥터 (Q, S단자)

 # Test_Terminal_2.jpg #

 커넥터 단자 위치


 2. 점화 시기가 사양을 벗어나면 디스트리뷰터 하우징을

 돌려 조정합니다.

< 4단계 : 엔진 공연비 확인 >

 1. 엔진 회전수를 2500 rpm 이상으로 2회 이상 무부하 가속을

 한 후 재확인합니다.

 2. 확인 후 메인 듀티값이 범위에 들지 않을 경우는 공연비

 조정을 재수행합니다.


 * 주의 : 냉각팬 작동시 메인 듀티를 조정하지 않습니다.

< 4단계 : 타르 제거 >

 1. 주행거리가 5,000 km 이상 경과된 차량에 대해서는 베이퍼

 라이저 하단부의 타르 레버를 사용하여 타르를 제거합니다.

 1) 차량을 난기시킵니다.

 2) 시동을 OFF합니다.

 3) 타르 배출 레버를 수평으로 위치하여 타르를 제거

 합니다.


 * 타르 배출 레버의 열림 또는 닫힘을 확인합니다.

[ 듀티 검사 ]


 본 기능은 공연비의 희박/농후 여부를 판정하기 위한 산소

 센서의 피드백 듀티를 검사하는 기능입니다.

 본 기능은 엔진 가동중에 검사가 가능합니다. 엔진이 충분히

 웜업된 상태에서 엔진이 가동중이면 [확인]버튼을 누르십시오.

 제어가 양호한 상태입니다.

< 3단계 : 아이들 CO 조정 >

 1. 베이퍼라이저의 공회전 조정 스크류 (IAS)를 조정, CO

 농도를 규정값으로 조정합니다.

 - 규정 아이들 CO값 : 0.1 % 이하

 2. 엔진을 2000 ~ 3000 rpm으로 가속한 후, 재확인합니다.

< 4단계 : 아이들 업 회전수 점검/조정 >

 1. 헤드램프를 켜서 (원등) 아이들업 솔레노이드를 작동

 시킵니다.

 2. 엔진을 약 2000 rpm으로 작동시켜 스로틀을 약간 열었다

 닫습니다.

 3. 아이들 회전수를 확인한 후 필요하면 아이들 업 스크류로

 조정합니다.

 - 규정 아이들 업 속도 : 800 ± 50 rpm

< 2단계 : 점화 시기 점검 >

 1. 점화 시기를 점검합니다.

 - 규정 점화 시기 : BTDC 15 ± 5'

< 3단계 : 엔진 공연비 조정 >

 1. 피드백 솔레노이드 값이 규정을 벗어나면 베이퍼라이저의

 공연비 조정 나사 (IAS)를 돌려 피드백 솔레노이드 듀티를

 조정합니다.


 - 규정 피드백 솔레노이드 값 : 50 ± 5 % (45 ~ 55 %)

< 4단계 : 아이들 업 회전수 점검 >

 1. 아이들 업 솔레노이드 밸브의 커넥터를 탈거합니다.

 2. 해당 아이들 업 솔레노이드 밸브 단자에 배터리 전압을

 인가하여 규정 RPM을 조정합니다.

 - 에어컨 : 1250 ± 50 rpm

 - 전기 부하 (헤드램프, 파워스티어링) : 1000 ± 50 rpm

 - 변속 레버 (N - D) : 1200 ± 50 rpm

# KAR4_2.jpg #

 믹서


 * 냉각팬 작동시 듀티 조정 금지

 * 엔진 회전수를 2000~3000 rpm으로 가속 후 듀티값을

 재확인 합니다.

[Electronic Water Pump(EWP) Actuation ]


 This function is used for removing excessive air from adding water 

 in the water coolant in hybrid motor vehicles after repairing 

 HSG/HPCU or repairing related EWP in electronic water pump system.


 [Condition]

 1. Ignition ON / Engine stop 

 2. NO DTC (EWP related code : P0C73)



 After adding water in the water coolant, press [OK] button.

[ Electronic Water Pump(EWP) Actuation ]


 <Caution>

 Electronic Water Pump actuation must be completed in 3 minutes. 

 To stop process during EWP actuation press [Cancel] button. 





 <<IN progress>> elapsed time : $$01 sec

[ Electronic Water Pump(EWP) Actuation ]


 Electronic Water Pump (EWP) actuation is completed.


 Check for surge inside the resolver ins water coolant. 

 If there is no surge noticed, retry the EWP actuation 

 after 30 seconds.



 Press [OK] button.

*기능 설명* 

 이 기능은 GDS TPMS를 통해 읽어들인 타이어의
 TPMS 센서 ID를 TPMS 컨트롤러에 입력하는 기능입니다.

 [읽은 ID]는 현재 TPMS 컨트롤러에 입력되어있는 센서 ID이고
 [작성된 ID]는 GDS TPMS를 통해 읽은 새로운 센서 ID입니다.

 * 이후 새로운 ID를 모두 읽어들인 후 
 쓰기 버튼을 누르면 새로운 ID가 TPMS 컨트롤러에 입력됩니다.

 *** 주 의 ***

 Low사양 TPMS 센서는 Low 버튼을 눌러 옵션에 맞게 설정
 하셔야 합니다.

 계속 진행 하시려면 [확인] 버튼을 누르시오.

[ 스타터 모터 작동 횟수 초기화 ]


 이 기능은 ISG 차량에서 스타터 모터 작동 내구 한계 도달

 (34만회)시점을 운전자에게 알려주기 위해 ECU에 적산된

 스타터 모터 작동 횟수 Counter 값을 초기화하는 기능입니다.


 * 스타터 모터 작동 내구한계값 도달시(34만회 이상) 표시장치

 (클러스터) 를 통해 운전자에게 알려 (자동 엔진 정지

 시스템을 점검하십시오)스타터 모터 교환을 유도합니다.


 [ 용도 ]

 ECU에 기록된 스타터모터 작동 횟수 적산(Counter) 값을

 초기화하는 기능으로 스타터 모터 작동횟수

 34만회 도달로 인한 신품 스타터 모터 교환시 또는

 34만회 도달 이전에 신품 스타터 모터 교환시

 반드시 실행해야합니다.



 [ 조건 ]

 1. 시동키 On

 2. 엔진 정지


 준비되면 [초기화]버튼을 누르십시오 !

[ EPS Type Recognition ]


 This function is used for loading accurate EPS type into

 the EPS control module.


 C1: Vehicle without ECS

 C2: Vehicle With ECS


 [C1] or [C2] Button Click.
반드시 신품 스타터 모터로 교환시에만 실행하는 기능입니다.\n\nECU에 기록된 스타터 모터 작동 횟수 적산(Counter)값을 초기화 하시겠습니까?

[Pressure Sensor Calibration] 


 This function is to initialize offset value of the pressure

 sensor.

 This function should be performed when the pressure sensor

 or ECU is replaced.


 [ CONDITION ]

 1. Don't press the brake pedal.

 2. Vehicle stands still. 

 3. Vehicle stays on a flat ground.

 4. Don't make any vibration

 5. IG ON 


 * While calibration is in progress, AHB is prohibited

 temperately. 


 If you are ready, press [OK] button.

[Failure Reason]


 1. There is DTC related to brake pedal travel sensor.

 2. Brake pedal depressed.

 3. IG OFF state.

 4. Vehicle speed more than 30 Kph

 5. No CAN message from HECU.

 6. Calculated pressure sensor offset value is

 out of normal range.

 7. During calibration, the signal of the pressure sensor

 is out of normal range.

[Brake Pedal Travel Sensor(PTS) Calibration] 


 This function is to initialize offset value of the brake pedal

 travel sensor.

 This function should be performed when the pressure sensor

 or ECU is replaced.


 [ CONDITION ]

 1. Don't press the brake pedal.

 2. Vehicle stands still. 

 3. Vehicle stays on a flat ground.

 4. Don't make any vibration

 5. IG ON 


 * While calibration is in progress, AHB is prohibited

 temperately. 


 If you are ready, press [OK] button.

$#01S 테스트 준비 $#01E $#02S 아래와 같이 차량을 준비 시켜 주십시요.
 1. 엔진 상태 : 공회전 (워밍업)
 2. 변속 레버 위치 : P 또는 N 
 3. 차량 상태 : 파킹 브레이크 작동 $#02E $#03S * 이 테스트를 성공적으로 완료한 후 재 검사를 하고 싶다면
 약 5분 정도 기다린 후 시도 하십시요. $#03E $#04S OK 버튼을 누르시면 테스트를 시작 합니다. $#04E

$#01S 테스트 조건 체크 $#01E $#02S OBD-II 데이터 저장 $#02E $#03S 엔진 회전수 (공회전 유지) $#03E $#04S 냉각수 온도 (60'c 이상) $#04E $#05S 배터리 전압 (11 ~ 15v) $#05E $#06S 연료량 (10 ~ 60%) $#06E $#07S 외기 온도 (15 ~ 25'c) $#07E $#08S 연료 탱크 압력 (대기압 수준) $#08E $#09S DTC Staus (NO DTC) $#09E
엔진이 400RPM 이하 입니다.\n 차량의 공회전 상태를\n 점검 하여 주시기 바랍니다.
냉각수온도 센서가 75'C 이하 입니다.\n 엔진을 워밍업 후 75'C 이상을\n 유지 하여 주십시요.
배터리가 저전압 혹은 과충전 상태 입니다.\n 배터리 및 발전기의 충전 계통을\n 점검 하시기 바랍니다.
연료량이 테스트 범위에 있지 않습니다.\n 연료량을 체크 하시기 바랍니다.
고장 코드가 검출 되었습니다.\n 고장 코드 부분을 확인 하시고\n 다시 실행 하시기 바랍니다.
테스트 조건이 완료 되었습니다.\n Evap leak 테스트 기능을 수행 합니다.

[STEERING ANGLE SENSOR CALIBRATION] 

 [PURPOSE] : 

 This function resets the SAS value to zero-set.

 Perform this function when you replace sensor

 or steering column.

 [CONDITION] : 

 1.Straighten the front tire.

 2.Arrange the steering wheel at the center position.

 3.IG key on 

 4.ENGINE Stop.

 5. In case of EPS equipped vehicle, perform STEERING ANGLE

 SENSOR CALIBRATION at the EPS system.

 Press [RESET] button, If you are ready.

 Press [CANCEL] button, If you exit.

[STEERING ANGLE SENSOR CALIBRATION] 

 [PURPOSE] : 

 This function resets the SAS value to zero-set.

 Perform this function when you replace sensor

 or steering column.

 [CONDITION] : 

 1.Straighten the front tire.

 2.Arrange the steering wheel at the center position.

 3.IG Key on 

 4.ENGINE Stop.

 5. In case of EPS equipped vehicle, perform STEERING ANGLE

 SENSOR CALIBRATION at the EPS system.

 Now CALIBRATION processing 

 Please wait for a monent.

[SAS & LONG. G SENSOR CALIBRATION] 

 [PURPOSE] : 

 THIS FUNCTION RESETS THE SAS AND LONGITUDINAL
 G SENSOR VALUE TO ZERO-SET.

 PERFORM THIS FUNCTION WHEN YOU REPLACE SAS
 OR YAW SENSOR

 OR STEERING COLUMN OR ESC H/UNIT.

 [CONDITION] : 

 1.NO DTC.

 2.ARRANGE THE STEERING WHEEL AT THE
 CENTER POSITION.

 3.CAR MUST BE STOPPED LONGER THAN 1 SEC.

 4.ON THE FLAT GROUND.
 [MAXIMUM RANGE OF THE SLOPE
 MUST BE WITHIN ± 1% (0.57˚)]

 5.TIRE PRESSURE MUST BE UNDER THE REGULATION.

 6.IG KEY ON 

 7.ENGINE STOP.

 PRESS [RESET] BUTTON,IF YOU ARE READY.

 PRESS [CANCEL] BUTTON, IF YOU EXIT.

[SAS & LONG. G SENSOR CALIBRATION] 

 [PURPOSE] : 

 THIS FUNCTION RESETS THE SAS AND LONGITUDINAL
 G SENSOR VALUE TO ZERO-SET.

 PERFORM THIS FUNCTION WHEN YOU REPLACE SAS
 OR YAW SENSOR

 OR STEERING COLUMN OR ESC H/UNIT.

 [CONDITION] : 

 1.NO DTC.

 2.ARRANGE THE STEERING WHEEL AT THE
 CENTER POSITION.

 3.CAR MUST BE STOPPED LONGER THAN 1 SEC.

 4.ON THE FLAT GROUND.
 [MAXIMUM RANGE OF THE SLOPE
 MUST BE WITHIN ± 1% (0.57˚)]

 NOW CALIBRATION PROCESSING 

 PLEASE WAIT FOR A MONENT.
